summary: This is an internal FBI email chain regarding the weekly Significant Activity Report (SAR) for the Epstein case. It provides statistics on victims contacted and services offered, showing coordination between New York and Miami offices.

events.title: Weekly Epstein Significant Activity Report Update
events.description: Internal FBI email requesting and providing an update on the number of victims contacted and services offered for the Epstein case.

keyFacts: As of August 15, 2019, the FBI had spoken to and offered services to 24 victims in the Epstein case (17 in New York, 7 in Miami).
Services offered to victims included interview assistance, crisis counseling, media information, and counseling referrals.
The FBI was in the process of coordinating services for 5 more victims at the time of the email.
This document shows the FBI was maintaining a weekly Significant Activity Report (SAR) to track victim outreach and support.
The email indicates coordination between the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking units in New York and Miami.
